image.altText: Several ambulances parked in emergency entrance to hospital.

props.synopsis: Important medical procedures including open heart surgeries have been cancelled at the Royal Hobart Hospital because of difficulty moving patients out of the emergency department, multiple medical unions claim.

title.children: Medics 'fed up' with having 'same problem every year' as chronic bed block cripples Hobart hospital

image.altText: a woman in a hospital bed taking a selfie

props.synopsis: Medical bills examined by experts reveals how Australian chronic pain sufferers are being apparently billed for fictitious services, inflated costs, and treatments for conditions they don't have.

title.children: 'I feel violated, I trusted them': Patients appalled after being shown the true nature of their medical bills

image.altText: Canberra gendered violence rally

props.synopsis: The footage of Anthony Albanese at a gendered violence rally outside Parliament House is nearly unwatchable. How can a political leader — whose entire skill set is supposed to be about competent judgement under fire — get it so horribly wrong?

title.children: 'I am the prime minister' should never be uttered by anyone. Albanese chose the worst possible moment

image.altText: High density housing with predominantly dark roofs.

props.synopsis: Property prices surged once again in April due the ongoing shortage of housing and rising demand. Could the rise of the YIMBY — or the "yes in my back yard" — movement be the solution to boosting the supply of affordable housing?

title.children: A lack of housing supply caused property prices to climb again in April. Is YIMBYism the solution?

image.altText: A close up shot of a sold sign outside of a property in the Albany Suburb of Mira mar

props.synopsis: Surprisingly strong inflation, but exceptionally weak retail spending, has major bank economists predicting the Reserve Bank won't cut interest rates until November.

title.children: Big four banks warn first rate cut won't come until November, as 'incredibly strong' migration makes the RBA's task 'more difficult'

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks while wearing a blue suit and red tie

props.synopsis: The judge overseeing the criminal trial fines the former US president $US9,000 ($A13,842) for online posts.

title.children: Donald Trump fined for breaching gag order in 'hush money' trial

image.altText: The Indian flag and Mike Burgess.

props.synopsis: Indian spies were kicked out of Australia after being caught trying to steal secrets about sensitive defence projects and airport security, as well as classified information on Australia's trade relationships.

title.children: India's Modi government operated 'nest of spies' in Australia before being disrupted by ASIO

image.altText: Bayley Turner, a trans woman, smiles brightly in front of a yellow background. She has her arms folded in front of her.

props.synopsis: In the wake of the #MeToo movement, intimacy coordinators including Bayley Turner have become fundamental to stage and screen productions.

title.children: How do TV shows navigate sex scenes on set? With help from intimacy coordinators like Bayley

image.altText: Powerlines suspended between towers against orange dusk  sky.

props.synopsis: Australians hoping for energy bill relief next financial year have been delivered a blow, with the cost of energy transmission set to rise in different parts of the country.

title.children: Electricity bills set to rise as Australian Energy Regulator sets new network transmission costs

image.altText: Cameron John Goss photo supplied by police.

props.synopsis: Family and friends of a man killed in a Tasmanian gold mine in 2020 say the $150,000 fine for the company is a "bloody joke" — calling on Tasmania to join the rest of the country in implementing industrial manslaughter laws.

title.children: Judge assures family penalty does not reflect worth of man's life as mining company fined a tenth of what it could have been

image.altText: Cyborg girl

props.synopsis: While artificial intelligence promises to make life easier, the technology is already affecting our mental health and understanding of reality, warns one neuroscientist.

title.children: From deepfakes to flirty chatbots, how AI is messing with our minds, relationships and sense of reality

image.altText: Nades, Priya and their two daughters, Kopika and Tharnicaa in Perth via Facetime.

props.synopsis: The Tamil family who fought a high-profile immigration battle to stay in the Queensland town of Biloela says if the federal government's proposed deportation changes were law during their saga, they would have been sent to jail.

title.children: Biloela Tamil family says government's proposed migration laws would have seen them jailed

image.altText: People holding signs objecting to violence against women.

props.synopsis: This morning, the nation's leaders will meet virtually to discuss the national crisis of male violence against women. But, what do survivors, advocates and experts want to see addressed in the National Cabinet?

title.children: 'I want to see a deep reckoning': What survivors, advocates and experts want out of national cabinet

image.altText: A profile image of a woman with long, ice blonde hair. She has a slight smile on her face.

props.synopsis: About a week after 28-year-old Molly Ticehurst was allegedly killed by her former partner, her family want urgent law reforms that would include monitoring devices for alleged domestic violence offenders.

title.children: Family and friends of Molly Ticehurst call for 'Molly's Law' to better protect people from domestic violence

image.altText: Parramatta children's court

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old who was charged following last week's counterterrorism raids across Sydney allegedly sought "dirty guns", a children's court has heard.

title.children: Teenager charged with terrorism offence allegedly sought 'dirty' guns, 'stash house'

image.altText: Rubbish is strewn across the grass

props.synopsis: A pool lined with green sludge, rotting roofs and termite infested buildings – this derelict island resort has become a sad tourist attraction for all the wrong reasons, and it's not an isolated case.

title.children: A pool full of green sludge and a feast for termites: How Queensland's island resorts fell into disrepair

image.altText: A man stands on an airport runway with his hands in his pockets.

props.synopsis: The company entered voluntary administration within hours of the cancellations. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: Who owns Bonza airlines? And why is the company in trouble?

image.altText: A Bonza plane sits on the tarmac behind a wire fence.

props.synopsis: Bonza's collapse is merely the latest in a long history of failed Australian airline experiments, but it probably won't deter others from going in on a wing and a prayer.

title.children: Bonza doomed to failure from the start, just like so many Australian airlines before it

image.altText: A composite image of Brittany Higgins and Linda Reynolds.

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds is suing Brittany Higgins and her fiancé David Sharaz over social media posts made in July last year.

title.children: Brittany Higgins fails in bid to delay defamation trial brought by Senator Linda Reynolds

image.altText: A bald man holds a giant cheque for $1.3 billion above his head.

props.synopsis: One of the winners of a $US1.3 billion ($A1.92bn) lottery jackpot revealed as an immigrant from Laos who has had cancer for eight years and had his latest chemotherapy treatment last week.

title.children: 'I need some help': Co-winner of $1.9 billion US jackpot is immigrant father from Laos who has cancer

image.altText: Bright red lava and ash erupts into the sky from a dark mountain

props.synopsis: The mass evacuation is the second of its kind this month, with authorities concerned about the potential of a tsunami being caused by the eruption.

title.children: Indonesia evacuates 12,000 people as volcano erupts again

image.altText: Farm workers picking tomatoes with a tractor in the background.

props.synopsis: Demand for Pacific Island seasonal workers is falling after a post-COVID boom in numbers, and some say one reason is changes requiring labourers receive at least 30 hours of work each week.

title.children: Farmers might be choosing backpackers over Pacific Island seasonal workers — and some say new rules are to blame

image.altText: A person holds a black wanding device with a green light on it

props.synopsis: The expansion of Queensland's wanding trial will allow police to stop and search someone for knives using metal-detecting wands at shopping centres, licensed premises, sporting and entertainment venues, and high-risk retail outlets.

title.children: Queensland stakeholders express concerns over expansion of trial allowing police to search people for knives

image.altText: Jim Chalmers speaks at a press conference inside parliament house

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says Australia is ready to embark upon a major overhaul of its foreign investment regulations to ensure critical industries, minerals and the national interest are not put at risk.

title.children: Treasurer announces major overhaul of Australia's foreign investment regulations

image.altText: Ninette Simons with severe facial bruising some days after the attack.

props.synopsis: Assault victim Ninette Simons has become the human embodiment of a saga that has been engulfing the federal government for six months.

title.children: The bloodied and bruised image that puts a human face on the High Court fallout

image.altText: Police standing outside an apartment with tape.

props.synopsis: The body of a 19-year-old woman has been found in an apartment in Sydney's eastern suburbs.

title.children: NSW Police confirm body of young woman found in North Bondi apartment

image.altText: A man in glasses and a brown shirt stands at a lectern delivering a speech.

props.synopsis: Manasseh Sogavare switched his country's diplomatic relations from Taiwan to China and amplified combative stoushes with Western democracies. What does his departure as prime minister mean for Solomon Islands and the region?

title.children: China's man in the Pacific has been booted out of office — and Australia is breathing a sigh of relief

image.altText: Two formally-dressed women walk next to each other with a man walking near them.

props.synopsis: The Queensland senator told court today that when she tweeted that Senator Mehreen Faruqi should "piss off back to Pakistan", she didn't realise the Greens senator was Muslim or that 97 per cent of the Pakistani population was Muslim.

title.children: Pauline Hanson tells court she didn't know fellow senator was Muslim when she tweeted she should go 'back to Pakistan'

image.altText: Keegan Payne kisses a barra

props.synopsis: Million Dollar Fish is an annual NT fishing competition where locals and tourists vie for barramundi tagged for big prize money.

title.children: 'This is crazy': Top End teen awarded $1m after reeling in prized fish

image.altText: a weather map showing rain across the state, particularly along the east coast

props.synopsis: Thanks to a stalled high-pressure system, known as a "blocking high", rain — and potentially flooding — could be on the cards for New South Wales.

title.children: Australia's weather map jams, leading to a prolonged soaking which may bring weekend flooding to NSW

image.altText: A group of people wearing masks holding up signs and flags.

props.synopsis: The student protesters were given a form to sign, acknowledging they would be suspended for their participation.

title.children: Columbia University begins suspending pro-Palestinian activists for refusing to pack up and leave New York campus

image.altText: A man in a suit smiling and pointing, as a woman smiles and walks behind him

props.synopsis: Flashing a broad grin, King Charles III returned to in-person royal duties on Tuesday, after more than seven weeks away from the spotlight.

title.children: King Charles all smiles as he visits cancer patients during first public engagement in months

image.altText: A black and white portrait of Prince William and Catherine on their wedding day.

props.synopsis: A new photo of the Prince and Princess of Wales on their wedding day has been published on the couple's social media accounts to mark their 13th wedding anniversary.

title.children: New photo from Prince William and Kate's wedding published for anniversary

image.altText: Police vehicles parked at crime scene.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old girl will remain in custody after being charged over the fatal stabbing of her younger sister in a suburb of Lake Macquarie in New South Wales.

title.children: Teenage girl charged with murder of her 10-year-old sister after stabbing at Lake Macquarie

image.altText: A phone with the TikTok logo displayed.

props.synopsis: A Canberra grandmother escapes conviction for filming a video containing child abuse material of her granddaughter and posting it privately to social media platform TikTok, in a case ACT Supreme Court Justice Belinda Baker described as "highly unusual".

title.children: Canberra woman avoids jail for posting video of granddaughter identified as child abuse material by TikTok
